isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC) SYSTEM - ProStar - DIAGNOSIS AND TROUBLESHOOTING

svcsubsecinfo.para: Diagnosis and troubleshooting of the HVAC system consists of the following steps:

item.para: Preliminary Checks - checking for physical damage and verifying the contents of the refrigerant system.

Diagnosis - identifying the probable causes of the system malfunction by observing diagnostic trouble codes, making physical checks, operating the system, and identifying fault symptoms during operation.
Troubleshooting - Isolating the fault by use of the troubleshooting tables.

A/C System Performance Test - Using test equipment to monitor A/C system parameters during operation. This is done to help identify faults during troubleshooting and to verify correct operation after repairs.

svcsubsecinfo.para: The DIAGNOSIS AND TROUBLESHOOTING FLOW CHART provides an overview of this process.
